Egypt's military shows power as country votes

As Egyptians voted in a second day of elections, the ruling military issued an interim constitution defining the new president's authorities. (AP)

Hotel Vendome fire victims honored

More than 200 people gathered at the Vendome Fire Memorial for a wreath-laying ceremony to honor the nine Boston firefighters who died four decades ago. (Globe)

Pictures: Pro-bailout Greek party elected

Fears of an imminent Greek exit from Europe's joint currency receded after the conservative New Democracy party came first in a critical election.

Pictures | Notable deaths of 2012

Rodney King dead at 47

Rodney King, whose 1991 videotaped beating by Los Angeles police officers led to some of the nation's most destructive race riots, has died.
  • Rodney King dies | Sign the guest book

Pope: Child abuse by clergy 'a mystery'

Pope Benedict XVI told Irish Catholics on Sunday it is a mystery why priests and other church officials abused children entrusted in their care, undermining faith in the church "in an appalling way." (AP)
